title: Lake Mead National Recreation Area: Climate Friendly Initiatives
body: Climate Friendly Initiatives          The Climate Friendly Parks (CFP) program is one component of the National Park Service Green Parks Plan, an integrated approach by the NPS to address climate change through implementing sustainable practices in our operations.                        Lake Mead NRA Green Parks Video See how Lake Mead NRA is green year-round. (3:23 min.)  Duration:3 minutes, 22 seconds                    World's First LEED Registered Floating Green Building Lake Mead National Recreation Area is home to the first LEED registered floating green building in the world. The floating eco-friendly structure features sustainable modular construction and state-of-the-art energy-efficient and environmentally responsible materials and fixtures. more...         Climate Friendly Parks Action Plan Lake Mead National Recreation Area, as a member of the Pacific West Region, is involved in the first regional effort in the National Park Service to become carbon neutral. The Lake Mead Climate Friendly Parks Action Plan outlines steps the Park will undertake to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and mitigate its impact on climate change. more...
